Uses of Class
gameMaster.TeamColour

  • Packages that use TeamColour 
    Package Description
    gameManager
    The next set of classes to be described is the Game Manager Classes, it isn’t as much of a set of classes but simply a singular class.
    gameMaster
    The Game Master is primarily responsible for keeping track of which player's turn it is, and determining win/loss game states once 3 or fewer units remain and a turn is ended.
    player
    The player sub system contains classes for Players and Robots, both of which have a single field which is their list of robots.
    units
    The units module is used to represent a “game piece” from the RoboSports board game.

    • Uses of TeamColour in gameManager

      Fields in gameManager declared as TeamColour 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private TeamColour[] GameManager.turnOrder
      An array of team colours that represents the turn order.

    • Uses of TeamColour in player

      Constructors in player with parameters of type TeamColour 
      Constructor and Description
      CPUPlayer(TeamColour team, int boardSize, java.lang.String tankScript, java.lang.String sniperScript, java.lang.String scoutScript, RobotObserver observer)
      Since every CPUPlayer needs to have three robots to exist this method will create those three robots; however, we need to pass in the three scripts.
      HumanPlayer(TeamColour team, int boardSize)
      Since every player always has the same three units upon initialization we will create them here.
